physical_findings: Asymptomatic, unilateral, well-defined brown to black macules
risk_factors: Living in tropical or subtropical regions

imaging_findings.dermoscopy: Can help distinguish tinea nigra from other brown-black skin lesions; may show wispy brown strands or pigmented spicules that do not follow dermatoglyphic furrows and ridges

required: Clinical presentation of asymptomatic, unilateral, well-defined brown to black macules on palms or soles
Microscopic examination of KOH preparations revealing pigmented yeast and hyphae
supportive: Skin biopsy showing characteristic histopathological features
